question.body: What is the major difference between lymph and interstitial fluid?

multiple_choice.choice: White blood cells are present in lymph
Red blood cells are present in interstitial fluid

response.feedback: Incorrect. The composition of electrolytes will be the same in both fluids.
Incorrect. White blood cells are found in interstitial fluid and blood.
Correct. Lymph runs through the lymph ducts and interstitial fluid is found within the tissues.
Incorrect. Proteins found in the interstitial fluid may also be found in the lymph.
Incorrect. Red blood cells should only be present in the vessels of the cardiovascular system. Finding them in the lymph or interstitial fluid means there has been damage to the blood vessels.

question.body: Lymph tissues serve two main function. They transport lymph and they house the cells that participate in the immune response. Which statement is not correct?

multiple_choice.choice: The diffuse lymph tissues are found in mucosal membranes and scattered around other lymph tissues such as Peyerâ€™s patches.
The fluids encountered by lymph tissues and as well as the spleen are interstitial fluids or lymph.
MALT lymph nodules are special because they are scattered throughout the mucosa of the gastrointestinal tract and the respiratory tract.
Many of the lymph tissues have germinal centers which house cells capable of dividing when stimulated by the correct antigen.

response.feedback: Correct. The spleen encounters only blood.
Incorrect. This statement is true. The MALT associated tissue are an important protection against antigens which we may ingest in our food.
Incorrect. Lymph immune tissues are generally quiescent unless stimulated by an antigen. The presence of germinal centers housing the appropriate stem cells allows for a rapid response.
